post_content:
While we’re holed up, it’s good to be productive and do some chores. But, it’s also okay to procrastinate, which means that you can Netflix and chill. Grady’s Lunarbaboon page started on Instagram and this half man/half moon monkey’s creations capture our sentiments perfectly.
View this post on Instagram

New comic! Stuck! www.lunarbaboon.com

A post shared by @ lunarbaboon on Mar 20, 2020 at 4:54am PDT
sub_category: Memes and Cartoons that Pretty Much Sum Up the World Right Now
sub_category_description:
Mark Twain had said, “Humor is the great thing, the saving thing after all. The minute it crops up, all our hardnesses yield, all our irritations and resentments slip away, and a sunny spirit takes their place.” In these difficult times, our survival kits could do some good with a dash of humor. For many of us, cartoons and memes provide us some respite as we practice social distancing and stay in. While some have a funny take on our quarantine lives, some are political enough to keep us aware of the situation and grounded at times like these. 

Here we have curated some memes and cartoons going around the Internet for you:

post_title: When you need to do more than sanitize
post_content:
Brian Gordon’s single-parent fowl in Fowl Language Comics is learning how to cope with all the bad news around, including the shortage of sanitizers. Sanitizer inventory is now at an all-time low, with major stores limiting the number of bottles you can purchase!
View this post on Instagram

And after enough “sanitizing” the world seems a tiny bit less catastrophic.

post_content:

View this post on Instagram

post_content:
Staying in means never-ending snack time. Unfortunately, being quarantined means very few opportunities to go scavenging for never-ending snacks. But how do we explain that to our brain? Nick Seluk’s gluttonous tongue in Awkward Yeti tells us how!

post_title: To do and not to do
post_content:
Need a primer on what to do and what not to do to lower your chances of infection? Brisa tells us how through her adorable comic panel. You can find her work that feature her significant other Joan and their dog Marly on Instagram @ThreeUndertheRain.
View this post on Instagram

English/Spanish ⏩ Available as a free printable in our website also in Italian, Portuguese, German and Dutch. Link in bio > footer menu > blog .Share this for maximum diffusion. Remember to follow your country or local guidelines and protect yourself and others. Keep calm, stay safe, and don’t rush to buy a lifetime supply of toilet paper (seriously, don’t). 💕Sending lots of love to everyone battling, and to all of those who stay in quarantine to help stoping the virus spread 💕💕🤗 #threeundertherain #3utr
